text: Theodor "Teddy" Kollek (; 27 May 1911 – 2 January 2007) was a Hungarian-born Israeli Labor politician. He was the mayor of Jerusalem from 1965 to 1993. He was the founder of the Jerusalem Foundation. Kollek was re-elected five times, in 1969, 1973, 1978, 1983 and 1989. He lost his re-election in 1993 to Likud candidate and future Prime Minister of Israel Ehud Olmert. During his time as mayor, Jerusalem became a modern city, especially after its reunification in 1967. He was once called "the greatest builder of Jerusalem since Herod." Teddy Stadium is named after him. Kollek was born in Nagyvázsony, Hungary. In 1935, shortly before Nazis took power of Austria, his family moved to Jerusalem. Kollek died on 2 January 2007 in Jerusalem at the age of 95. ==References== Category:1911 births Category:2007 deaths Category:Austrian Jews Category:HaAvoda politicians Category:Hungarian Jews Category:Israeli civil servants Category:Israeli mayors Category:Jewish Israeli politicians Category:Naturalized citizens of Israel Category:Politicians from Jerusalem Category:Refugees from Nazism
title: Teddy Kollek
